snippet.description:
More on this school: http://www.edutopia.org/stw-student-stress-meditation

Surrounded by poverty and escalating violence, a San Francisco middle school committed to peace and embraced a program of meditation that has made students feel safer, teachers more productive, and brought unity and purpose to the school. Click "like" if you enjoyed this video!
snippet.title: Meditation Helps Lower Truancy and Suspensions

contentDetails.note: Zachary Fink (Director of Video Programming): Love this video for its compelling story and cinematic approach. This troubled middle school took a risk and tried a program called Quiet Time, with stunning results.

snippet.description: Edutopia.org's Director of Video Programming, Zachary Fink, interviews UC Berkeley professor Dor Abrahamson about how to increase students' understanding of math. For more on Dor Abrahamson, visit http://www.edutopia.org/blog/applied-mathematics-video-dor-abrahamson
snippet.title: How To Make Math Meaningful

contentDetails.note: Doug Keely (Associate Producer): One of my favorites has to be the Dor Abrahamson piece. I love the use of the music (that's Dor playing the cello), multiple cameras, and just great storytelling by such a fun and quirky character!

snippet.description: At KIPP King Collegiate High School, in San Lorenzo, California, the mission is to provide students with the critical-thinking skills required to succeed in college -- and the confidence to use them. For more Edutopia.org coverage of KIPP King Collegiate, go to http://www.edutopia.org/stw-kipp-critical-thinking
snippet.title: Critical Thinking Wins the Day at a KIPP High School

contentDetails.note: Lora Ma (Executive Producer, Web): I graduated from a tough, urban high school and I know the obstacles these kids face. So when I heard that the educators at this school are making it their goal to get every student through college, I was already inspired!

snippet.description: Student-driven class activities, enhanced by technology, launch kindergartners on a journey of lifelong learning. See more ideas about immersing young learners in self-directed projects: http://www.edutopia.org/kindergarten-project-based-learning
snippet.title: Five-Year-Olds Pilot Their Own Project Learning

contentDetails.note: Amy Erin Borovoy (Digital Media Curator): Even though this video is an old one, it has a special place in my heart because while I was there for the shoot, I loved seeing the light of understanding go on for such tiny kids -- and I knew they would become lifelong learners!

snippet.description: The founder of Khan Academy (http://www.youtube.com/khanacademy), a free educational video library that features over two thousand titles and an interactive dashboard for formative assessment, discusses how his videos can help create a "flipped classroom" that allows lectures to happen at home and project-based learning to happen during school. For more about blended learning, visit http://www.edutopia.org/blog/combining-blended-and-project-based-learning
snippet.title: Khan Academy Founder Salman Khan on Liberating the Classroom for Creativity

contentDetails.note: Daniel Jarvis (Video Editor): Sal Khan is the "it" guy in education right now and his interviews are all over. But this one is unique because Sal digs into what his lessons offer teachers and coaches in the realm outside the Khan Academy website -- and it's just plain exciting.

snippet.description: Even the smallest things, like the living cell, become big enough to grasp in Rob Olazagasti's middle school science class, where he enables students to learn by creating, remember by experiencing, and show what they know by teaching.
snippet.title: Thinking Big About Engagement

contentDetails.note: Mariko Nobori (Digital Media Producer): I love what the science teacher in this video is doing in his classroom -- incorporating art into science, having the students teach to build their confidence in the material, and using student-generated metaphors to bring relevance.

snippet.description: This successful performance artist credits his career pathway program for making high school relevant. For more videos, articles, and downloads from Edutopia's coverage of Merging Career Tech and College Prep, visit http://www.edutopia.org/stw-career-technical-education
snippet.title: David Garibaldi: From Outlaw to International Hip Hop Artist

contentDetails.note: Laurie Chu (Web Production Manager): I love the Garibaldi video. I think he's great and speaks directly and personally to career and technical education in a way that teachers really can't.

snippet.description: Mesquite Elementary School developed a teaching strategy called "Reteach and Enrich" that emphasizes differentiated instruction and teacher collaboration. The result: student achievement increased significantly in just 6 months. If you enjoyed this video, don't forget to "like" it or add it to your favorites!
snippet.title: Differentiated Instruction in the Classroom at Mesquite Elementary School

contentDetails.note: David Markus (Editorial Director): They were the lowest-resourced district in the state -- and they had a student achievement problem. So they dug in and built an instruction-based solution. Love this story. You will be inspired, and you may want to try some of their stuff.

snippet.description: By guiding her students through rigorous projects aimed at illuminating solutions to real-world problems, McCray uses Outward Bound principles to tap into students passions for learning. For more information from our Schools That Work series, please visit: http://www.edutopia.org/maine-project-learning-ideas-school-leadership
snippet.title: Teacher Susan McCray Lights the Fire of Project Learning

contentDetails.note: Elana Leoni (Social Media Marketing Manager): One word -- wow! High school teacher Susan McCray reveals her inspiring real-world expeditionary learning projects and they are so compelling!

snippet.description: Tucson elementary schools find success by infusing art and music into every discipline. Learn more in our "Why Arts Education Must Be Saved: Special Report": http://www.edutopia.org/arts-opening-minds-integration
snippet.title: Music and Dance Drive Academic Achievement

contentDetails.note: Carl Bidleman (Former Syndication Manager): 1st graders writing their own opera -- I smile every time I see these kids singing!
